summary: This bill, S. 1897, amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to establish the Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) Response Team grant program. The program authorizes the Attorney General, in coordination with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, to award grants to states, local governments, and organizations. These grants will fund ACE response teams to address trauma exposure in children, including establishing protocols, developing referral partnerships, integrating services, providing training, and supporting cross-system collaboration. The bill also authorizes $10 million for each fiscal year from 2026 to 2029 to carry out part PP.
